meanings.sent1: The picnic was a washout due to the sudden rainstorm.
meanings.sent2: The project turned out to be a washout after all the delays.
meanings.sent3: The magician's performance was a washout when his rabbit disappeared and never returned.
meanings.sent4: The party was a washout, with no one showing up despite the invitations.
meanings.sent5: The movie premiere was a washout with technical difficulties ruining the experience for everyone.

meanings.definition: The act of washing out or cleaning something.
meanings.sent1: After the paint job, the washout of the brushes took a long time.
meanings.sent2: The laundry room had a special sink for washout of paint and other materials.
meanings.sent3: The washout of the car was necessary after the muddy off-road adventure.
meanings.sent4: The washout of the driveway was done with a powerful hose to remove all the dirt.
meanings.sent5: The washout of the stains on the carpet required a strong cleaning solution.

meanings.definition: A person who is unsuccessful or unreliable.
meanings.sent1: He was known as a washout in the company after missing multiple deadlines.
meanings.sent2: The team considered him a washout when he failed to score in crucial matches.
meanings.sent3: The new employee turned out to be a washout, always forgetting important tasks.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a washout after not being able to complete the marathon.
meanings.sent5: The candidate was labeled a washout by the voters after his scandalous behavior.
